The other issues are the pay has to be based on a national company average and not a local average because Naples Fl with what wadges and cost of living are the numbers do not align and would make it extremely difficult for one to live a life unless your collecting SS and have this job. title: Community Manager
pros: Sun treats each and every employee like they are the same no matter what their position is here. It truly is a team environment and rarely feels like an employee-employer relationship
cons: Sometimes it feels like you are out on an island when there are no other communities close by.

title: Trying but management needs to open their eyes
pros: I believe Sun and its main players try to be a good company. They have good benefits and PTO. They have been emphasizing diversity and equity along with the rest of the world. I feel as if the culture at the corporate office is healthy and the people that work there are genuine and willing to help.
cons: Profits and shareholders will always be the main priority. While it is understandable for a public company the budgeting does not allow for much room to deal with the needs of the communities. The workload in the field is tremendous and Community Managers wear a lot of hats. DVP's and SVP's are always ready to chop heads yet they offer little support.

title: Best job ever
pros: Sun challenges you in a way that promotes growth and learning in a very fast paced environment. They provide tons of support from the corporate office, and they also assign you a mentor manager to help you through the training process. There is also a Learning and Development team who is always there to answer questions you may have. The company trust you to run the property as if it were your own business. I really do appreciate that kind of freedom in my job. It empowers me and makes me want to do better everyday.
cons: I work a ton of hours, however, I do that because I take great pride in my community and its appearance.

title: Best I've Ever Worked For in 17 Years of Management!
pros: (1) Employment policies and procedures are set in writing; you know what to expect and what is expected of you. (2) You work for a company that is the best in the business and their numbers prove it. (3) The team you get to work with is awesome as everyone has the same goals in mind. (4) It's a Michigan based company. (5) Unlimited potential; working with a large and growing company means there are tons of avenues you can pursue within your career.
cons: Pressure. Sun wants the team to be the best it can be so it pushes everyone to maximize their potential. For some, this pressure to be the best can overwhelming.

title: The culture of the company is refreshing and Elevating!
pros: To find a company who mirror my core values is refreshing and breath taking. It's hard to find a company whose philosophy is to treat others with respect and integrity and actually follow through with that philosophy. I have found my home after 14 years in the business. It's wonderful to work for a company who empowers its team members. You truly feel like you are part of something big and making an impact in people’s lives.
cons: The implementation of new policy and procedures can use some improvement as to how they are rolled out. They do try as a company to make the transition smooth, but at times miss the mark.

title: 2 yrs. and wanting more!
pros: the pro's to my job is obviously meeting new people all the time and making new connections in the Golf industry. I enjoy meeting people and learning new things My wish would be to learn more of the Operations Side of Sun and to become more of a leader on the Golf side of things I absolutely love the game and appreciate the opportunity to work within it. And to represent Sun while doing so.
cons: Occasionally a difficult client but that's part of the deal, And I believe there is a lot more opportunity in the Golf course's than is being realized by leadership. But also don't believe there is anyone focused on the opportunity and Golf solely.

title: Top heavy, good ole boy network
pros: I've met some lifelong friends.
cons: I would have rated Sun at a 5 a few years ago however the oast few years it gone downhill. They have become very top heavy with everyone no being directors. The main office used to support the field but now there is no support. To many directors and VPs beating up on field team members. Sun still can't open its eyes and see they have bad apples but continue to watch managers walkout while undeserving RVPs get promoted or praised. Just like Rome, a collapse is inevitable.

title: Community Manager
pros: Commissions are good when you can sell homes, lease homes. a good benefits package
cons: all the hours you work is not worth the pay, managers should be entitled to holiday bonuses just as well as its community employees, because it is just not fair, They say we get commissions in place of holiday bonuses but as you know we work hard for our commissions with long hours to get quota so all you at the big house can succeed. With out us there would be no you!!!!!!!!

title: Politics!
pros: Most of the people are super helpful and welcoming. Remote option possibly if you work for the main office. The company is growing and acquiring new business all the time. The outlook is good for them as a whole.
cons: Unorganized, promote known bullies, push their political agenda on everyone, no work/life balance, the supervisor I had wasn't understanding about being a parent. Busted my butt and got more slaps on the hands than pats on the back. Very little training...thrown into the deep end and if you sink you'll hear about it, if you swim, you won't.

title: Really like it!!!!
pros: Sun Communities is an outstanding company to work for. The managers and co workers are great here. They truly care about the employees and there is a balance of work and personal life. I am not stressed out when I go home and don't dread getting up in the morning coming in. That's a plus for me. The work is not that hard but interesting. It does get extremely busy but they make up for it will all the perks that we get. Overall a great company!
cons: Have goals to work towards. If you want to move up you have to apply to a different position. There is not a lot of opportunities in current positions meaning if you are a CSR there is no CSR II. You have to leave the dept. that you are in to advance. Training on new software could be better as well.

title: Good Benefits but Blatant Discrimination
pros: Overall the environment was decent to work through ...... at times. Benefits are good, but expensive for a family and when they added on their COVID tax
cons: Management is unaware of what is going on in other departments. Upper management is far removed from day to day going on with employees HR department does not work to help employees when complaints are filed against managers, instead they will actively work to write you up. Clear discrimination against employees who announce they are pregnant, have small children or are unwilling to work OT due to family obligations or a work-life balance. Compensation is below national average and most employees are working 2-3 other jobs to make ends meet.

title: Working at Sun
pros: Working for Sun, I experience a lot of gratitude from management and fellow team members for what I do! We're experiencing a lot of growth and it points to a longevity and stability for the company, which is reassuring! I find that if I need help or an explanation, everyone is more than willing to work with me.
cons: It can be difficult to deal with both main office and the field, given that I don't have first hand experience as to what the field team members experience.

title: Promising Future
pros: Working for Sun has definitely been an experience. There is so much opportunity to grow and learn each and every day. My peers are always ready to help with a simple phone call. Sun empowers their team members to take the initiative to better themselves and their team. The benefits are amazing.
cons: If I had any cons about the company it would be to listen a bit more when the management in the field speak in regards to the commissions and bonuses. Not arguing that they are bad as they are not. I just feel they could be structured a bit different to be fair to all team members and not just one team member.

title: Thankful for my time at company and the experience that I gained but in the end I was just a number.
pros: There is potential for a good income, free housing & benefits with a generous amount of PTO time as well.
cons: Work tons of hours, very stressful, lots of changes regularly with senior management, very demanding at times.

title: Field Employees are 2nd Class
pros: Pro female work place Generous PTO for hourly employees
cons: Lots of benefits are only offered to main office. Field managers don't get true PTO, not even close. Travel team let me know that I just reply to their emails immediately whether I'm on PTO or not. RVP says we have to reply to customer emails no matter what. Accounts payable sends you reminders that you have to code every incoming expense same day, although they take a week to mail a check out to a vendor. Everything has a convoluted process. Managers are expected to accept any treatment by customers and apologize for the customers poor behavior. Archaic. Low pay for hourly team members unless your manager wants to fight them for you.

title: Great structure, people in it terrible.
pros: As a community manager the pay is very fair, benefits fair, hours required fair, overall work load fair.
cons: Cronyism among regional level on up. You will get thrown under the bus if you do not hit goals, no matter if your immediate supervisor stands in the way of your every move. They make you live on-site, you never get any rest from tenants or owners.

title: Low Regard For Employees
pros: At the park I worked at, we had a great atmosphere in the office. Me and the other office coordinator got along famously and we really had a great team. The job of Guest Services Coordinator isn't that hard, the job isn't that stressful, but there are moments.
cons: I am a seasonal employee and the RVP looked my coworker, who was a regular employee, in the eye and promised her they would make me a regular, full time employee. Then they only offered me part time. You get minimum wage as a season employee and they don't give you paid holidays. They also allow residents to treat the staff like crap and completely disregard what other residents say.

title: Sun Communities Does Not Abide By Their Own Cultural Statements
pros: Residents Job Duties Location Living On Site
cons: Sun Communities fosters and supports toxic work environments. And what happened to the Human in Human Resources? Oh there is no human. You are only supported if you play the politics. People talk through their jobs instead of doing their job. Fake and Superficial. They are hypocritical and judgemental. You are only a number and they only respect you if you play by their rules and sell homes. Basically keep your mouth shut. Suck it up! Don't make waves! Just do your job that's it PERIOD!

title: Sales Counselor
pros: Great Benefits Great communities to sell from.
cons: Need to have more educated support at corporate for your sales team. Need to have better protocol for when issues arise with employees to make sure they get FAIR treatment in all situations.

title: A walk in sun
pros: There are many pros to sun ,a good team ,and hard work being the start in the six year that I have been with sun I have had the privilege to meet many wonderful people ,and have the chance to visit and work in many different communities, and striving to walk the path of good service and suns goals ,I dont consider myself yet fully learned in as anything I do as I'm still learning new techniques from time to time ,my team is always ready to offer advice and guide me in what ever I try to achieve .
cons: Its gets real cold real wet and windy in Michigan :(

title: Poor salaries, worse raises
pros: The company has no pros concerning its employees. They do not provide a living wage to there employees while making a billion dollar profit annually.
cons: Maintenance Techs, should have a starting rate of at least 15/hr. The Maintenance Supervisor should start at $18/hr. Both based of of experience in the field. Paying your Maintenance Techs $12/hr with 30 cent yearly raises is a slap in the face. No wonder the turnover at this position is extremely high. First of all at $12/hr you can't attract the right personel to apply for the position. Then if you do, 30 cents a year, with no incentives as far as rent bonuses, or sale bonuses, like the office people receive, then u won't keep them.

title: Main Office Employee
pros: They treat their employees with the utmost respect. Between the communication thats passed on from all levels, the major perks (cafe, gym, awesome building), benefits (a ton of PTO, good benefits) I couldn't ask for more! Yes, the workload is heavy but it is to be expected at such a large company. They are constantly asking for feedback and new ideas of how to make our work more efficient. I have to say I don't struggle to get out of bed everyday or to walk into this office building because they make it a fun energized place to work!
cons: Work life balance is pretty difficult. When you have kids at home, the long hours weigh on the family.

title: Super Charged - Super Pumped!
pros: Customer Service and Innovation are #1 & #2 Priorities for Sun and they stand solid behind their commitments. Whether you are working at the community level or the main office level all employees are valued with The Golden Rule , treat others and you wish to be treated is the standard that drives day to day operations! Great place to work and grow!!
cons: If you like change this is the place for you! If not, and if change comes hard for you this may not be your cup of tea. Pace is fast and focus is required to keep up with this dynamic corporation!

title: Disrespectful executives full of cronyism
pros: The main office building in Southfield Michigan is nice and they take care of main HQ people much better than the field employees. Parking is easy.
cons: Major cronyism at the executive level and upper management. If you don't keep your head down and stroke their egos you will be beaten, bullied, and made persona non grata. Beware IT, HR,and Accounting - they are the worse! The execs lie and they know it and laugh. Instead of dealing with the root problems they just move people around or get rid of them.

title: Fulfilling learning experience
pros: I had an incredible experience with my manager, whom herself is an incredible person and hardworker but was also enabled through company policies in regards to employee growth. My manager truly cared about my career path and at the end of my seasonal term she took the time to call other offices with Sun on my behalf to find continued employment for me. My experience with her management was focusing on developing my softskills, giving me better verbiage to better service our guests, and too few employers offer coaching for soft skills. It is very much thanks to this job that I've been able to go on and succeed at other customer service and sales positions.
cons: Part time was limited strictly to 20hrs/wk during peak hours 11-4 made it difficult to get a second job. Corporate policies were very restrictive for residents.

title: 1 year Anniversary
pros: It's been one year since I started working here and I have learned so much and every day we are learning something new.
cons: The only down side I think is the change in how commissions are paid out now. There are three OC's here and you can only split with one person where as before it was split evenly with the three of us. I would love to see the system updated so that can happen or go back to the split sheet.

title: Sink or Swim
pros: Friendly co-workers, management does want you to succeed and do well and truly does try to be helpful, nice RVP. Good benefits and paid time off.
cons: Sink or Swim training. Since I started I have been thrown in the deep end with minimal guidance and have had to teach myself my job. I work in an extremely busy office, which is why it’s been challenging for our community manager to give more formal training. Upper management and HR ought to really have a solution to this issue. For such a big company why isn’t there a better system in place? It is not fair to make new hires just navigate their way through everything blindly and be expected to perform their jobs correctly.

title: Very Pleased
pros: I've been very happy working at Sun Communities! I enjoy the culture here, which has been fun and friendly but also professional. Upper management has been genial and training has gone very well. For the most part, I am given clear direction and have not experienced any micro-management. All issues have been dealt with appropriately. Lastly, there have been some very nice perks like the main office's "Double-Wide Cafe," trips, occasional bonuses, etc.
cons: Our company has expanded in recent months and there have been some "growing pains." Everyone's workload has increased and while they are hiring new people, I feel like some better pre-planning could have ameliorated some of the workload.

title: Opportunity
pros: Pros are if you work hard and commit to excelling with the tools that you are given, Sun gives you the opportunity to move up, because have been with Sun for 9 months and through hard work it has afforded me the opportunity to be promoted and I'm ready for more. The support system is great and the opportunity to excel at other properties are there, because the company is so large, your productivity is up to you. Professional growth to excel in a larger role is available to you.
cons: Cons are the starting pay, but you can work to move up to larger properties with more sales commission opportunities.

title: Stressful
pros: It is a great job,if you enjoy working with resident's and applicants. Benefits are good, co workers good, PTO time great,if you can use it and your RVP dont make you feel guilty for taking off.
cons: Very stressful at month end. Its all about making them money. No family life,must work after hours from home to catch up. Always have a feeling you will be losing your job. Every year, they take more away from you in commissions. Work load is horrendous!

title: Great Position With Advancement Opportunities
pros: Uses a good reward system, great support from corporate office and surrounding communities, opportunities for advancement as they always post job opportunities within the company before sharing publicly so as to hire from within.
cons: I was told my position could lead to full-time hours. Months later my regional manager (same woman who originally told me that) said that I was working too many hours and that the position wasn't meant for full time. Thing is, someone always must be in the office during office hours and with a small community of about three-four employees there was some struggle to find balance. I would have preferred just to be made full time.

title: Main Office - Operations
pros: Great benefits, generous pto, amazing perks like free fitness center w personal trainers/classes, private Starbucks (free or near free drinks) annual bonus, obtainable merit pay increases, really nice and fun outings and annual holiday parties. They also dona great job rewarding employees with internal transfer/promotion opportunities.
cons: It seems a lot of lower to middle management is lacking in their ability/skills to coach, respect and empower their team. On the other hand that is not case for all middle to lower management - yet true in more instances than I wish there were.

title: Opportunities Abound
pros: National company with opportunities throughout the US and in Canada Fantastic energy and dedication from upper management Exhibit the Golden Rule daily A corporation to be proud of making it easy to promote
cons: Still relatively young and growing all the time. If you work with Sun you need to be the type of team member that is not thrown off by new changes and adaptations. The goal is always to make the processes better.

title: 17 years and how we have changed!!!
pros: A progressive and innovative company that values their people and promotes new ideas and processes. We never stop growing. Sun has changed a lot over the years; but has never lost sight of it is the people that make the company special. A leader in the industry. Work hard and you will be justly rewarded.
cons: Often takes long hours to reach the goals I have set. Sometimes balance between personal and work is rather lopsided.

title: Career Path
pros: Sun is a company that treats you like family. As a manager if you work hard and commit to the success of your team members and make yourself accountable your career path will take you where you want to be.
cons: If I must say something it would be that the company could increase their salaries, so that it attracts better qualified candidates. Also, the hiring process takes an extended longer process, but I just believe that they take the time to hire right people.

title: Administrative Assistant (Construction Services)
pros: This is the best company that I have ever worked for. Everyone is a team player, and is recognized for their hard work and dedication. Everyone is proud of their own work and work completed by others. There are so many perks I can't name them all. And Sun Communities has the friendliest employees and Management staff. I am lucky to be a part of the Sun family and team.
cons: truction Services)

title: I have worked for Sun homes for more than a year
pros: Comfortable work environment. 401K matching up to 5%, dental and vision for hourly staff members. Vacation days given if you can ever get time off approved by management.
cons: No Major Medical for hourly staff. No on the job training from day one. Overworked team members and management in under staffed communities. Very little perks for hourly and perks for management are over the top when hourly do all the work. Team Moral is about the worst I have experienced.

title: Terrible Company - Does Not Care About You!!!
pros: Experience in what NOT to do.
cons: Terrible management. They reward those that do nothing an reprimand those that do everything. No sense of open door policy. No training. Had a manager that kept telling me she was "there for me" but when I asked her for assistance she would speak to me in a condescending tone as if I were to know all the answers and not help at all! As a sales representative you get paid very little and have to do a whole lot. Yes you get commission but commission is sporadic AND they hold commission from you until company is funded...we did our job why should we HAVE to wait to get paid????

title: Amazing Opportunities for Growth!
pros: Whether you're looking to start your career or take that next step, this place is perfect for you. Sun has a great leadership team who listens to their team members. Amazing transparency of company updates and handled the pandemic with grace by implementing safety protocols and abiding by CDC guidelines. This company will only continue to grow! Perks: Free exercise classes (in person and over Zoom during pandemic), gym access, cafeteria w/Starbucks, great benefits and PTO allowance, volunteer opportunities for community service, ability to work from home for many main office positions, annual bonuses, great discounts on resort stays, and more!
cons: I haven't found any yet!

title: Sun Communities is a great place to work and live!
pros: Here at Sun we have a great team to work with and a satisfying mission of provided exceptional service to our team and community! When you can look back on your day and know that you made a difference in contributing to someone's happiness and well being, it is very satisfying!
cons: When you do your job with dedication, consistency and with a positive attitude there are no cons, because you can rise above any situation.

title: Manager
pros: The community offers so much room for growth not just with promotions, and they are limitless, but within the scope of management. I love it. it is like an education on a daily basis. I love you Sun!!! and yes, thank you for the wonderful training. it was Empowering!!!
cons: a little stressful I will admit, but not in anyway that will bring you down. Everyone I am in direct contact with has been where I am, so the support is great. really no down side.

title: RV and MH parks
pros: Great customers and great co-workers
cons: Too many decisions regarding park policy is subject to management and changes frequently. Management gets all the credit for sales and does not have to share the commission even if they do not do the work. A lot of work and responsibility for mediocre pay in comparison to similar roles in the area and the benefits have a very high deductible.

title: Manager Leasing Agent
pros: Public relations and really enjoy the apartment business.
cons: From ledger posting to all computer although it is much easier. I really have no complaints about the business because I am learning at the same time. I have been through new contruction, rehab, upgrade etc. And like it all!

title: Great company!
pros: Down to earth and approachable leadership up to the top, invest in employees learning and growth. Fun company events for holidays, summer, and off-site conference bi-yearly. Fair company that is always looking to be innovative and improve.
cons: Field employees are all over the US which makes it difficult to see each other in person frequently, but the company utilizes technology to engage through video. This is also a pro though, due to getting to know others in different states and connecting through technology.

title: *APPLICANT BEWARE*
pros: Decent salary if you are motivated.
cons: HUGE lack of support from Regional Vice Presidents who are basically District Managers. Was directly told by upper management that we are just numbers to them. Unrealistic goals set forth constantly and when not met upper management covers their own rear end. This company traps managers from leaving by offering them a 'free' community home to reside in. If you are terminated you must vacate within 30 days, if you quit, immediately. Prepare for 70 hour work weeks and anti-anxiety meds with no positive feedback from your supervisor.

title: Good Pay and Perks, Not all Managers are Created Equal
pros: Good pay, onsite fitness center with free classes and personal training, yearly bonus and raises. *Good portion of the managers want to help you grow and develop.
cons: Depending on department you could be looking at a lot of hours making it difficult to have a fair work/life balance. There are definitely some bad apples when it comes to middle-upper Management. Those who have a bad attitude and do not treat everyone with respect. Those who do not have a good line of communication with their team, and the last thing on their mind is mentoring or developing their team members.

title: Not what it used to be
pros: Majority of the team members were great to work with. Decent benefits but high premiums.
cons: Heavy workload and no overtime. Too many clicks at all levels. Too many pockets being padded and upper management has no clue. Harassing at times.

title: Anniversary
pros: The encouragement received for advancement is incredible and the training received during this time has been invaluable. Receiving help when needed from other managers has been so helpful.
cons: It's difficult at this time to say any downside to working with this company, I would guess the only thing that I can see is that the pay structure for Sun is lower than a lot of the other management companies in the area.

title: If you are hard working and dependable, don't apply - they only keep and promote the mediocre to substandard employees.
pros: Company is stable. Corporate office has tons of perks - on site gym, trainers, yoga instructors, "team building events" off site, break area with yogurt machine. Promote from within the company first before looking outside the company.
cons: Turnover is tremendous. They keep mediocre to substandard employees on the community level and invent reasons to terminate hard working dependable employees. Do not monitor community managers work ethic at all. Management is only focus is numbers and how to make them look good while fattening their pocketbooks.

title: Fun while it lasted
pros: Great people to work with locally. All attempting to do best they can with what they have to work with.Great working with in spite of unreasonable projections and interference from upper management.
cons: Site management micro managed by upper management to the point of interference on small issues when larger issues as far as maintenance of facilities and protection of assets of company not addressed in timely manner.Degradation of properties on going problem due to lack of control by management at upper staff level.

title: HR doesn't care, only Managers matter
pros: Salary and benefits are decent.
cons: The Regionals only care about the Managers. Same with HR. I complained to HR about sex discrimination, hostile work environment and retaliation from my supervisor. No one even responded to my complaint, let alone investigate it! I wrote to the COO John McLaren and he never responded either.

title: RV Resort Manager
pros: I absolutely love working for Sun Communities! I am so very thankful to have landed here. I have never seen so much excellent support and training! Our Concierges team is beyond amazing! Anything you need help with , they are there to assist. My Learning & Develoment coach has been such a valuable part of my success. I love that my RVP and DVP are both so hands on and involved. I could not ask for a better place to work. I truly love going to work everyday and know that this is the company I will retire from! Our top leaders/CEO's and CFO's are approachable and involved. They are down to earth people who honestly care about us and our residents! I feel like I finally found a company that gets what it's all about!!!
cons: Really none that are any type of issue. Maybe I could say , Lots of emails to keep up with! It can be super demanding and a little stressful at times, but manageable and totally worth it! The rewards out weigh any con.

title: Resort manager
pros: Great benefits & perks, travel
cons: Community managers are given very little help in operation policies, it appears that Regional managers are only in it for the pay and not the pride. Too much emphasis is put in their power until they make a mistake, then the community manager takes the fall.

title: Values Professional Development and Provides Mentorship
pros: Company values developing employees professionally and promoting from within. Regular 1 on 1’s with management and quarterly reviews are used to ensure you are staying on track towards your goals in your current role and future career goals. You will get opportunities to be exposed to very different projects, be afforded training in new skills, and company will send you to courses and workshops to assist with gaining certifications that benefit both parties.
cons: Employees are not always aware of the professional development opportunities. Some managers do not make it a point to encourage employees to discuss their career goals, with the assumption that the employees will be the ones to broach the topic. This leaves the more reserved less aggressive employee feeling as of there is no room for growth, feeling unappreciated and stuck in their role.

title: Tremendous potential which made it so much more disappointing
pros: The culture at Sun was/is amazing and the people were fantastic. I feel the company overall does care about their employees and seemed to listen well enough when concerns were raised. There are opportunities for the right people who are willing to put the hours in, work hard, and fight for the success of the company.... if you can get through to management.
cons: Listening and executing are two very different things. The company has so much potential but it's upper management that is holding it back. Boast six sigma experience among upper management, but that doesn't fix the fact that the company is not changing with market trends and technology. A big con is having management in place that aren't willing to take and act on critical advice, do what it takes to grow the business, connect with their future audience and be the best in the business. Extensive meeting schedules, not enough investment in the right resources for key teams, lack of accountability for mid-upper management, and occasional communication break downs made some larger projects extremely frustrating. Disrespectful community managers who think the company runs around their operation made getting some tasks completed next to impossible. Upper management just couldn't seem to let the reins go and trust in their teams.

title: Property manager
pros: Work with really good people Paid well for hard work They do what is right.
cons: Be good at property management or this job will be tough. This is a results driven company and you will be held to a high standard. This is not really a con but you need to be the best :)

title: Excited for the New Adventure
pros: Sun Communities is an amazing company for many reasons. The opportunities are boundless if you are willing to grow. The Sun University program is full of information and teachings to better ourselves. The outreach from our RVP's and DVP' as well as the corporate office is outstanding.
cons: There would only be one CON I have and that is sometimes it is hard to get answers from the corporate office or our RVP's because they are just to busy to respond to us.

title: A company that Truly Values its Team
pros: Large Growing Company with lots of room to grow as a team member. They truly believe in their culture. If you want to be challenged, learn new things and work with great group of people this company is where its at!
cons: At times because of the size of the company certain administrative aspects of human resources slow down the process. However the company does a great job making up for it in other areas.

title: A great start..
pros: employee benefits and perks are great if you're outspoken, competent and passionate, you'll do well.
cons: Pressure is placed on middle management while senior level is not held accountable at all and that's where the primary problems are. not much incentive to go above and beyond. poor performers are not dealt with as they should be.

title: 1 Yr. Anniversary
pros: WOW! how fast did that year go by. But what a Great experience so far, I can't wait to see whats ahead. I love being a part of The Sun Team. And being able to interact with the Residents here at The Hamptons Golf & Country Club. Thanks to All who have supported and helped me along when I needed it.
cons: Have not experienced any yet.

title: Office Coordinator
pros: Paid holidays, decent amount of paid time off (4 weeks), benefits and HR department are very helpful, always kept busy
cons: Pay is just over min wage starting at $11 an hour for full time, $10 an hour for part time in the same position. Hourly employees not paid enough for the work they do and customer service they give to the residents.

title: A great company
pros: Working with great people, being able to meet great residents and making people happy with in the resort. Watching and being involved with the growth of a property.
cons: Upper Managment not supportive enough .sometimes not at all. You have to be able to make good choices and be a self starter .Not a good balance of off time. You have to be VERY devoted to this job to be successful.

title: Best company Honored to be part of the Sun team
pros: Best company I have worked for love how Sun cares for all their employees thank very much
cons: Nothing everything is positive great upper management

title: Sr. Community Manager
pros: Sun Communities offers limitless opportunity to advance and promote up within the organization. The support staff is fabulous and quick to assist with any concerns.

title: Sun Communities....the best property management company I have ever worked for.
pros: Senior Management listens to it's onsite managers. The benefits are good, the salary is very fair and working conditions are great. There is plenty of support from superiors at all levels all the way to the top. Everyone is treated fairly. They pay their bills in a very timely manner. Contractors always want to work with Sun. Regional management is always available in person or by cell phone for support. It is truly a TEAM company.
cons: Wish there was more opportunity for advancement within the company or more notice when there is an opening at another property that you might want to transfer to. Other than that there is no downside to this great company.

title: Downhill Slide...
pros: The local team members with Sun are fantastic - there is a sense of camaraderie that I have not found in any other industry or job setting, and you develop lifelong friends and relationships.
cons: When I started with Sun, it was a growth- and people-oriented business with the primary focus on the folks that worked for the company and the folks the company worked for...excellent company. Over the last couple of years, though, there has been a noticeable downhill trend on all fronts and it hasn't gone unnoticed. The demand on employees has risen exponentially, but the pay scales continue to drop and there is little-to-no recognition for accomplishments. Support from senior management is declining, and even business ethics have come into question more and more.

title: Successful, empowering environment
pros: Sun promoted me from within, and hires other experienced in the field. Sun promotes learning, and empowers their managers and VPs to improve properties and operations. I have found 2 mentors that I can reach out to anytime for guidance or advice. As a Resort Manager, they offer a manager's residence property to live in on-site. Sun continues to grow their portfolio in the USA and Canada.
cons: There are a lot of spinning plates to operate an RV property, how you keep them spinning is up to you!

title: From the start Sun has been nothing short of awesome. Friendly management, honest people and great environment.
pros: The owners of the homes at Sun properties are a blast, and the management and coworkers are awesome. They pay you properly and you can request time off and often get it! You always know when you’re working and can bank on consistency in shifts and job duties are pretty simple.
cons: Working every weekend all summer is a bummer but you are allowed to request a weekend off if you need it.
